properties.name: Windy Post Bullseye
properties.description: Bull's Eye - A stone set in the bank of a leat having a hole drilled to release water from the leat into a branch channel. It can be stopped at will with a turf. Hemery, 1983. p.28

properties.name: Ham Green Viaduct
properties.description: Ham Green Viaduct is on the ex-Great Western Railway Launceston-Tavistock-Plymouth line, now the Plym Valley Railway Path. There was originally a timber viaduct on this site and the stone piers for this can still be seen beneath the present viaduct, which was built in 1899. The timber viaduct was opened on 21st June 1859 when the line completed to Tavistock. Stations were provided at Bickleigh, Horrabridge and Tavistock, all of which opened to traffic on June 22nd 1859. The line closed to passengers in 1962 and goods 1964. After the scrapmen cleared the line it lay quietly decaying until the coming of the cycle route.

properties.name: Western Machinery
properties.description: Meeting place up the lane from where Western Machinery used to be.
